about.description:
The HTCondor Python bindings aim to expose a high-quality,
Pythonic interface to the HTCondor client libraries. They utilize
the same C++ libraries as HTCondor itself, meaning they have
nearly the same behavior as the command line tools.

name: python-htcondor
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.20.5
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
    name: python-htcondor
    version: 8.9.9
source:
    patches:
        - cgroup.patch
        - disable-dlopen.patch
        - paths.patch
        - python-archlib.patch
        - python-no-libpython.patch
        - rpath.patch
    sha256: 781619576df53b2352fc21e8aa7ffd145f783145f1fce001b99c2d5ae5ce5907
    url: https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor/archive/V8_9_9.tar.gz
build:
    ignore_run_exports:
        - gct
        - libuuid
        - pcre
        - python
    number: 2
    string: py36h4ece66e_2
requirements:
    build:
        - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 conda_forge
        - _openmp_mutex 4.5 1_gnu
        - binutils_impl_linux-64 2.35.1 h17ad2fc_0

        - cmake 3.18.4 h1f3970d_0
        - expat 2.2.9 he1b5a44_2
        - gcc_impl_linux-64 7.5.0 hd9e1a51_17
        - gcc_linux-64 7.5.0 he2a3fca_29
        - gxx_impl_linux-64 7.5.0 h7ea4de1_17
        - gxx_linux-64 7.5.0 h547f3ba_29
        - kernel-headers_linux-64 2.6.32 h77966d4_13
        - krb5 1.17.2 h926e7f8_0
        - ld_impl_linux-64 2.35.1 hed1e6ac_0
        - libcurl 7.71.1 hcdd3856_8
        - libedit 3.1.20191231 he28a2e2_2
        - libev 4.33 h516909a_1
        - libgcc-devel_linux-64 7.5.0 h42c25f5_17
        - libgcc-ng 9.3.0 h5dbcf3e_17
        - libgomp 9.3.0 h5dbcf3e_17
        - libnghttp2 1.41.0 h8cfc5f6_2
        - libssh2 1.9.0 hab1572f_5
        - libstdcxx-devel_linux-64 7.5.0 h4084dd6_17
        - libstdcxx-ng 9.3.0 h2ae2ef3_17
        - libuv 1.40.0 hd18ef5c_0
        - make 4.3 hd18ef5c_1
        - ncurses 6.2 h58526e2_4
        - openssl 1.1.1h h516909a_0
        - pkg-config 0.29.2 h36c2ea0_1008
        - rhash 1.3.6 h516909a_1001
        - sysroot_linux-64 2.12 h77966d4_13
        - tk 8.6.10 hed695b0_1
        - xz 5.2.5 h516909a_1
        - zlib 1.2.11 h516909a_1010
    host:
        - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 conda_forge
        - _openmp_mutex 4.5 1_gnu
        - boost 1.72.0 py36h79e6602_1
        - boost-cpp 1.72.0 h9359b55_3
        - bzip2 1.0.8 h516909a_3
        - ca-certificates 2020.11.8 ha878542_0
        - certifi 2020.11.8 py36h5fab9bb_0
        - gct 6.2.1550507116 h8cfc5f6_2
        - htcondor-classads 8.9.9 h58526e2_2
        - icu 67.1 he1b5a44_0
        - ld_impl_linux-64 2.35.1 hed1e6ac_0
        - libblas 3.9.0 3_openblas
        - libcblas 3.9.0 3_openblas
        - libcondor_utils 8.9.9 h84da495_2
        - libffi 3.2.1 he1b5a44_1007
        - libgcc-ng 9.3.0 h5dbcf3e_17
        - libgfortran-ng 9.3.0 he4bcb1c_17
        - libgfortran5 9.3.0 he4bcb1c_17
        - libgomp 9.3.0 h5dbcf3e_17
        - liblapack 3.9.0 3_openblas
        - libopenblas 0.3.12 pthreads_h4812303_1
        - libstdcxx-ng 9.3.0 h2ae2ef3_17
        - libtool 2.4.6 h58526e2_1007
        - libuuid 2.32.1 h14c3975_1000
        - lz4-c 1.9.2 he1b5a44_3
        - munge 0.5.13 h1a52d62_0
        - ncurses 6.2 h58526e2_4
        - numpy 1.19.4 py36h8732dcd_1
        - openssl 1.1.1h h516909a_0
        - pcre 8.44 he1b5a44_0
        - perl 5.32.0 h36c2ea0_0
        - python 3.6.11 h4d41432_2_cpython
        - python_abi 3.6 1_cp36m
        - readline 8.0 he28a2e2_2
        - setuptools 49.6.0 py36h9880bd3_2
        - sqlite 3.33.0 h4cf870e_1
        - tk 8.6.10 hed695b0_1
        - xz 5.2.5 h516909a_1
        - zlib 1.2.11 h516909a_1010
        - zstd 1.4.5 h6597ccf_2
    run:
        - boost >=1.72.0,<1.72.1.0a0
        - htcondor-classads 8.9.9 h58526e2_2
        - libcondor_utils 8.9.9 h84da495_2
        - libgcc-ng >=7.5.0
        - libstdcxx-ng >=7.5.0
        - python >=3.6,<3.7.0a0
        - python_abi 3.6.* *_cp36m
test:
    commands:
        - python -m pip install --no-deps --index-url nothing htcondor
    imports:
        - classad
        - htcondor
    requires:
        - pip
about:
    description: 'The HTCondor Python bindings aim to expose a high-quality,

        Pythonic interface to the HTCondor client libraries. They utilize

        the same C++ libraries as HTCondor itself, meaning they have

        nearly the same behavior as the command line tools.

        '
    dev_url: https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor
    doc_url: https://htcondor.readthedocs.io/
    home: http://htcondor.org/
    license: Apache-2.0
    license_family: APACHE
    license_file: LICENSE-2.0.txt
    summary: Python bindings for HTCondor
extra:
    copy_test_source_files: true
    final: true
    recipe-maintainers:
        - duncanmmacleod
        - jasoncpatton

about.description:
The HTCondor Python bindings aim to expose a high-quality,
Pythonic interface to the HTCondor client libraries. They utilize
the same C++ libraries as HTCondor itself, meaning they have
nearly the same behavior as the command line tools.
